instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 PCH heating up
threads.message: Board came in with very little water damage near U3200 and PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS was shorted to ground from the CD3215 being shorted, I replaced the CD3215, short is gone but board tries to start with USB power but no USB activity and no VCORE, while inspecting with thermal camera PCH gets a little hot around 40c and U3900 also gets a little hot at around 36c, board gets 20v at 0.25a and stays there.

threads.title: 820-00840 PCH heating up
threads.message: You should check power on sequence; classic signals and voltages.
